org.hackystat.sensorshell
Class SensorProperties

java.lang.Object
  org.hackystat.sensorshell.SensorProperties

public class SensorProperties
extends java.lang.Object

Provides access to the hackystat properties file for each sensor, and provides reasonable default values when properties file is missing, cannot be read, or lacks property values.

The sensor properties file is stored in userhome/.hackystat/v8.sensor.properties. It is a user-maintained file of key=value pairs.

All of the properties in sensor.properties are added to the System property instance after being read from the file. This enables other tools that interoperate with Hackystat to obtain settings from the System instance and/or environments to configure System property settings (such as for SSL) simply by adding entries to the properties file.

Author:
Philip M. Johnson

Constructor Detail

SensorProperties

public SensorProperties()
Initializes based on the user's v8.sensor.properties file.

SensorProperties

public SensorProperties(java.lang.String host,
                        java.lang.String email,
                        java.lang.String password)
Creates a "minimal" sensor properties file usable for test case purposes. Needed by SensorShell which must be passed a SensorProperties object containing a host, email, and password.

Parameters:
host - The hackystat host.
email - The user's email.
password - The user's password.

SensorProperties

public SensorProperties(java.io.File sensorFile)
Provides access to Hackystat Sensor settings by reading the passed file.

Parameters:
sensorFile - The sensor file to read.
Method Detail

getSensorPropertiesDir

public java.io.File getSensorPropertiesDir()
Returns the directory in which the sensor.properties file is located (if it exists). This is normally the .hackystat directory. If this SensorProperties instance was created without a sensor.properties file, or if for some other reason the sensor.properties file cannot be found, then this method returns null.

Returns:
A File instance indicating a directory, or null.

getProperty

public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)
Returns the trimmed property value associated with the property key in this sensor.properties file.

Parameters:
key - The parameter key.
Returns:
The trimmed property value associated with this property key, or null if not found.

getHackystatHost

public java.lang.String getHackystatHost()
Returns the hackystat host. Defaults to http://localhost/.

Returns:
The hackystat host.

getAbsolutePath

public java.lang.String getAbsolutePath()
Returns the absolute path to the properties file, or the empty string if the file is not available.

Returns:
The absolutePath value or the empty string.

getPassword

public java.lang.String getPassword()
Returns the password for this user. Defaults to "ChangeThis"

Returns:
The user password.

getEmail

public java.lang.String getEmail()
Returns the email for this user. Defaults to "ChangeThis@changethis.com"

Returns:
The user email.

getAutoSendInterval

public java.lang.String getAutoSendInterval()
Returns the AutoSend interval for use by the SensorShell, or 10 if it was not specified. Returned as a string since it is typically sent off to the SensorShell as a String argument.

Returns:
The autosend interval.

getStateChangeInterval

public int getStateChangeInterval()
Returns the StateChange interval for use by sensors, or 30 if it was not specified. The stateChange interval must be greater than 0.

Returns:
The state change interval in seconds.

isFileAvailable

public boolean isFileAvailable()
Returns true if the sensor properties file was found and read successfully.

Returns:
True if file was found and readable.
